title: Lorimer
content:
It's like a rounder softer version of Eurostile but I haven't been able to find what it is   
exactly. Samples below are from a processed photo. Thanks.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824053750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32132.gif)  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824053750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32133.gif)
author: bernard

comments.content: Could be customized - is it a logo?

[Cosmotron](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824053750/http:/www.union-fonts.com/displayfonts.php?category=sanserif&offset=9) from Union Fonts is very similar, however, the 't' is different. (Spotted in Indie Fonts 2)

Could be customized. It's the address of a new highrise complex. Here it is in context.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824053750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32140.jpg)   
It's the closest I've seen so far to the custom acens logo   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19876.html?1068324954](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824053750/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19876.html?1068324954)
